1289419_16_ITEM15_P71_S0	Joe Mansueto, as Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of Morningstar, Inc. (the Company), certifies, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:
1289419_16_ITEM15_P72_S0	The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
1289419_16_ITEM15_P73_S0	St phane Biehler, as Chief Financial Officer of Morningstar, Inc. (the Company), certifies, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:
1289419_16_ITEM15_P74_S0	The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P0_S0	Morningstar is a leading provider of independent investment research in North America, Europe, Australia, and Asia.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P0_S1	Our mission is to create great products that help investors reach their financial goals.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P0_S2	We offer an extensive line of data, software, research, and investment management offerings for financial advisors, asset managers, retirement plan providers and sponsors, and individual investors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P0_S3	We currently serve approximately 250,000 financial advisors, 1,400 asset management firms, 27 retirement plan providers, 300,000 retirement plan sponsors, and 10.9 million individual investors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P0_S4	We also provide data on the private capital markets to approximately 2,000 institutional clients.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P1_S0	Our data and research are core assets that we seek to leverage to build Morningstar's long-term value.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P2_S0	Morningstar provides extensive data and research insights on a wide range of investment offerings, including managed investment products, publicly listed companies, private capital markets, and real-time global market data.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P3_S0	Our data and proprietary analytical tools such as the Morningstar Rating for mutual funds, which rates past performance based on risk- and cost-adjusted returns, and the Morningstar Style Box, which provides a visual summary of a mutual fund's underlying investment style, have become important tools that millions of investors and advisors use in making investment decisions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P3_S1	We've created other tools, such as the Ownership Zone, Sector Delta, and Market Barometer, which allow investors to see how different investments work together to form a portfolio and to track its progress.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P3_S2	Our popular Portfolio X-Ray tool helps investors evaluate their portfolios and get a clear view of their underlying holdings.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P4_S0	We ve been providing independent analyst research on mutual funds and other investment vehicles since the mid-1980s.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P4_S1	We use this analyst research to provide a qualitative, forward-looking Morningstar Analyst Rating for funds.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P4_S2	We now provide research reports and Morningstar Analyst Ratings for approximately 4,100 funds globally, including active, passive, multi-asset, ETF, and closed-end fund strategies.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P4_S3	We also offer qualitative research and ratings on alternative funds, state-sponsored college savings plan portfolios, and target-date funds.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P4_S4	During 2016, we began providing qualitative analyst ratings on ETFs and qualitative coverage of separately managed accounts.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P5_S0	In 2016, we introduced the new Morningstar Sustainability Rating for funds, which helps investors evaluate funds based on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P5_S1	Morningstar now provides Sustainability Ratings for approximately 34,000 mutual funds and ETFs, encompassing $27 trillion in assets under management, or more than half of fund assets globally.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P6_S0	As part of our research efforts on individual stocks, we popularized the concepts of economic moat, a measure of competitive advantage originally developed by Warren Buffett, and margin of safety, which reflects the size of the discount in a stock's price relative to its estimated value.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P6_S1	The Morningstar Rating for stocks is based on the stock's current price relative to our analyst-generated fair value estimates, as well as the company's level of business risk and economic moat.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P6_S2	Our analysts cover approximately 1,500 stocks using a consistent, proprietary methodology that focuses on fundamental analysis, competitive advantage assessment, and intrinsic value estimation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P7_S0	In addition to our analyst-driven coverage, we provide quantitative ratings and reports for approximately 42,000 companies globally.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P7_S1	These equity ratings draw on the fundamental research of our equity analyst team and provide a forward-looking statistical view of the valuation, competitive advantage, and level of uncertainty for stocks that are often under-followed by other research firms.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P8_S0	Through our Morningstar Credit Ratings, LLC subsidiary, which is a Nationally Recognized Statistical Rating Organization (NRSRO), we provide new issue and surveillance ratings and analysis for commercial mortgage-backed securities (CMBS), residential mortgage-backed securities (RMBS), and other types of asset-backed securities.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P8_S1	In 2016, the Securities and Exchanges Commission (SEC) authorized Morningstar Credit Ratings to rate corporate issuers and financial institutions under its NRSRO registration.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P9_S0	In our investment management business, we've developed in-depth advice on asset allocation, portfolio construction, and security selection to meet the needs of investors and professionals looking for integrated portfolio solutions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P9_S1	We ve published research on "Gamma," an innovative measure that quantifies how much additional retirement income investors can generate by making better financial planning decisions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P9_S2	We use the concept of human capital or potential future earning ability to provide a more complete picture of an investor s financial worth and optimize a portfolio s asset mix.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P10_S0	We believe investors rely on these tools because they offer a useful framework for comparing potential investments and making decisions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P10_S1	Our independence and our history of innovation make us a trusted resource for investors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P11_S0	Our strategy is to widen our economic moat, or sustainable competitive advantage, and build shareholder value by focusing on our three key objectives, which we describe in more detail below.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P11_S1	Our investment data, research, and ratings are at the heart of our strategy, allowing us to help investors achieve better investment outcomes whether they make their own investment decisions or outsource management of their portfolios.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P12_S0	1. Produce the most effective investment data, research, and ratings to help investors reach their financial goals.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P13_S0	We believe our leadership position in independent investment research offers a competitive advantage that would be difficult for competitors to replicate.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P13_S1	Our goal is to leverage our proprietary research and intellectual property to help investors with both decision support (via Morningstar Direct) and outsourced investment management (via our investment management business).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P14_S0	We re focusing our research efforts on several different areas, as described below.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P15_S0	Our goal for manager research is to leverage our leadership position to reach additional customers globally.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P15_S1	In contrast to most other companies, we also integrate manager research with our software, which we believe is another competitive advantage.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P16_S0	As of December 31, 2016, we had 120 manager research analysts, including teams in North America, Europe, Australia, and Asia.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P17_S0	Our equity research complements our approach to manager research, where we focus on analyzing the individual stocks that make up each fund's portfolio.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P17_S1	As of December 31, 2016, we had more than 100 equity analysts globally, making us one of the largest providers of independent equity research.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P17_S2	We believe our analysts long-term approach, deep industry knowledge, and focus on sustainable competitive advantage are important factors that set us apart and help investors achieve better investment outcomes.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P18_S0	Morningstar Credit Ratings, LLC, our credit ratings subsidiary, is a Nationally Recognized Statistical Rating Organization (NRSRO) that has historically focused on structured finance.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P18_S1	As mentioned above, the SEC recently approved an expansion of the NRSRO license for Morningstar Credit Ratings to cover credit ratings for corporate issuers and financial institutions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P18_S2	Our goal is to bring transparency, unique perspectives, and superior client service to investors across the fixed-income markets.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P19_S0	Over the past several years, we ve developed new research tools that provide a more holistic approach to investing and asset allocation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P19_S1	Whereas traditional asset allocation methodologies focus solely on financial assets (such as stocks and bonds), we ve developed methodologies that provide a more complete view of all sources of wealth, including financial capital, human capital, housing assets, and retirement and pension benefits.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P20_S0	Develop Morningstar Direct as our flagship decision support platform.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P21_S0	In 2015, we began rolling out the next-generation version of Morningstar Direct, our institutional investment research platform.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P22_S0	The new software is designed to be more intuitive, elegant, and easy-to-use.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P22_S1	It provides a more consistent, cohesive experience with a strong emphasis on Morningstar s proprietary research and tools.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P22_S2	We also improved the underlying technology, including a more streamlined development process for commonly used Morningstar capabilities such as portfolio management tools.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P23_S0	The new software is fully web-based, which eliminates the need for desktop software installations and allows immediate access to new features.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P23_S1	It allows to us innovate more rapidly and more easily configure our software solutions to meet client needs.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P23_S2	It also addresses the growing need for mobile-optimized capabilities to extend the desktop experience onto mobile devices.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P24_S0	Over the past several years, we've started migrating many of our core software capabilities to Morningstar Direct, which will serve as our main platform for clients looking for information to support the investment decisions they make on their own or validate investment recommendations from another party.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P24_S1	We're also continuing to expand the user base for Morningstar Direct by enhancing capabilities for our existing asset management clients and adding workflows for new types of clients, such as financial advisors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P25_S0	3. Build world-class investment management solutions based on our proprietary research.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P26_S0	We leverage our innovative, proprietary research by building world-class investment management solutions that help investors achieve better outcomes.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P26_S1	Our goal is to connect our existing capabilities to create holistic solutions that help financial advisors, asset managers, and individual investors with portfolio construction, monitoring, security selection, and implementation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P27_S0	Our investment management solutions include Morningstar Managed Portfolios, which had $29.8 billion in assets under advisement as of December 31, 2016, and Workplace Solutions (formerly Retirement Solutions), which had a total of $104.4 billion in assets under management and advisement.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P28_S0	We also expect to expand the investment management solutions we offer through our index business.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P28_S1	We currently offer more than 350 investment indexes that can be used for both benchmarking and product creation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P29_S0	Given the core capabilities discussed above, we're focusing on five primary customer groups:
1289419_17_ITEM1_P30_S0	Financial advisors work with individual investors to help them reach their financial goals.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P30_S1	This customer group includes independent advisors at registered investment advisor (RIA) firms, advisors affiliated with independent broker-dealers, dually registered advisors, and captive advisors who are employees of a broker-dealer.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P30_S2	Captive broker-dealers include wirehouses, regional broker-dealers, and banks.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P30_S3	In total, Cerulli Associates estimates there were approximately 310,000 financial advisors in the United States as of the end of 2016.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P31_S0	We believe our deep understanding of individual investors needs allows us to work with advisors to help them make more efficient use of their time and deliver better investment outcomes for their clients.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P31_S1	Our advisor solutions also draw on Morningstar s proprietary investment research methodologies and research insights.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P32_S0	We sell our advisor-related solutions both directly to independent financial advisors and through enterprise licenses, which allow financial advisors associated with the licensing firm to use our products.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P33_S0	We're expanding the range of services we offer to help financial advisors with all aspects of their daily workflow needs, including investment decision-making, portfolio construction, client monitoring and reporting, practice management, portfolio rebalancing that connects with custodial and trading interfaces, and financial planning.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P33_S1	Because advisors are increasingly outsourcing investment management, we're continuing to enhance Morningstar Managed Portfolios to help advisors save time and reduce compliance risk.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P34_S0	Our main products for financial advisors are Morningstar Advisor Workstation (including Morningstar Office) and Morningstar Managed Portfolios.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P35_S0	Asset management firms manage and distribute investment portfolios.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P35_S1	We estimate that there are more than 3,000 asset management firms globally, ranging from large, global firms to firms with small fund lineups and operations in a single market or region.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P36_S0	The asset management customer group includes individuals involved in sales, marketing, product development, and distribution, as well as investment management (often referred to as the buy side ), which includes portfolio management and research.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P37_S0	Our asset management offerings help companies connect with their clients because of Morningstar s strong brand presence with both financial advisors and individual investors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P37_S1	We offer a global reach and have earned investors trust in our unbiased approach, investor-centric mission, and thought leadership.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P38_S0	Our goal is to expand our reach with asset management clients and individuals at these firms who employ Morningstar s research offerings to help them achieve better results for their clients.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P38_S1	We also plan to leverage our proprietary research and data to continue developing differentiated software and data offerings.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P39_S0	The key products we offer for asset management firms include Morningstar Direct, Morningstar Data, and Morningstar Indexes.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P39_S1	For the buy side, key products include Morningstar Research, Morningstar Credit Ratings, Morningstar Data, and Morningstar Direct.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P40_S0	In the workplace (also known as retirement) market, millions of investors are now charged with planning for their own retirement, mainly through self-directed retirement plans such as 401(k) plans in the United States.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P40_S1	Assets in 401(k) plans totaled an estimated $4.6 trillion as of December 31, 2016, based on data from Cerulli Associates.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P41_S0	In the wake of the financial crisis of 2008 and 2009, we believe individual investors, financial advisors, employers, and government organizations have all become more aware of the need for advice and guidance that helps individuals build assets for retirement and beyond.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P42_S0	Our retirement offerings help retirement plan participants of all ages plan and invest for retirement.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P42_S1	We offer these services both through retirement plan providers (typically third-party asset management companies that provide administrative and record-keeping services) and directly to plan sponsors (employers that offer retirement plans to their employees).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P43_S0	Our main product offering for the workplace/retirement customer group is Workplace Solutions, which includes managed retirement accounts, fiduciary services, custom models, and financial wellness services.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P44_S0	We offer products for individual investors who invest to build wealth and save for other goals, such as retirement or college tuition.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P44_S1	A Gallup survey released in April 2016 found that approximately 52% of individuals in the United States invest in the stock market either directly or through mutual funds or self-directed retirement plans.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P45_S0	We design most of our products for individual investors who are actively involved in the investing process and want to take charge of their own investment decisions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P45_S1	We also reach individuals who want to learn more about investing or want to validate the advice they receive from brokers or financial advisors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P46_S0	Our main product for individual investors is Morningstar.com, which includes both paid Premium Memberships and free content available to registered users and visitors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P46_S1	We also reach individual investors through a series of investment newsletters, iPad and mobile applications, and through licensing our content to other websites, such as Yahoo Finance, MSN Money, and Google Finance.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P47_S0	Through PitchBook Data, Inc. (PitchBook), which we acquired in December 2016, we reach approximately 2,000 investment and research firms, including venture capital and private equity firms, corporate development teams, investment banks, limited partners, lenders, law firms, and accounting firms.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P47_S1	These clients use PitchBook s industry-leading platform and best-in-class user interface to access data, discover new connections, and conduct research on potential investment opportunities.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P48_S0	PitchBook covers the full lifecycle of venture capital, private equity, and mergers and acquisitions (M A), including the limited partners, investment funds, and service providers involved.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P48_S1	Our main product for this customer group is the PitchBook Platform, an all-in-one research and analysis workstation for sophisticated investment and business professionals.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P49_S0	Since our founding in 1984, we've supported our organic growth by introducing new products and services and expanding our existing offerings.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P49_S1	From 2006 through 2016, we also completed 30 acquisitions to support our growth objectives.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P49_S2	We made three acquisitions in 2016:
1289419_17_ITEM1_P49_S3	Requisight, LLC (RightPond), a provider of business intelligence data and analytics on defined contribution and defined benefit plans for financial services firms; InvestSoft Technology, a provider of fixed-income analytics; and PitchBook, a leading source for information on the private capital markets, including venture capital, private equity, and M A.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P50_S0	For more information about our acquisitions, refer to Note 7 of the Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P51_S0	The section below describes some of our major products and services (ranked in order of size based on each product's 2016 revenue).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P52_S0	Morningstar Data gives institutions access to a full range of investment data spanning numerous investment databases, including real-time pricing and market data.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P52_S1	We offer licenses and data feeds for our proprietary statistics, such as the Morningstar Style Box and Morningstar Rating, and a wide range of other data, including information on investment performance, risk, portfolios, operations data, fees and expenses, cash flows, and ownership.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P52_S2	Institutions can use Morningstar Data in a variety of investor communications, including websites, print publications, and marketing fact sheets, as well as for internal research and product development.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P53_S0	We also offer Morningstar Data for equities, including financial statement data, consolidated industry statistics, stock ownership information, and proprietary Morningstar statistics.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P54_S0	In 2016, we added several new sets of data to our suite of offerings, including the Morningstar Sustainability Rating for funds, our new Global Risk Model, and ETF Analyst Ratings.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P54_S1	We also continued expanding the breadth and depth of our global data coverage for both equities and real-time data.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P55_S0	We ve continued developing our data delivery platforms, including application programming interfaces (APIs), which allow for faster and more flexible client access to large groups of data files.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P55_S1	We ve expanded the number of data sets that are available through APIs and expanded the scope of data provided at the request of our clients.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P56_S0	Pricing for Morningstar Data is based on the number of investment vehicles covered, the amount of information provided for each security, the frequency of updates, the method of delivery, the size of the licensing firm, and the level of distribution.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P57_S0	Our main competitors for Morningstar Data include Activ Financial, Bloomberg, FactSet, Financial Express, Interactive Data, S P Global, Thomson Reuters, and Xignite.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P58_S0	Morningstar Data is our largest product based on revenue and accounted for 19.0%, 18.3%, and 18.4% of our consolidated revenue in 2016, 2015, and 2014, respectively.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P59_S0	Morningstar Direct is an institutional investment research platform that includes data and advanced analytical tools on the complete range of securities in Morningstar's global database, as well as privately held investments and data from third-party providers.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P59_S1	It helps portfolio managers, investment consultants, financial product managers, wealth managers, and other professionals develop, select, and monitor investments.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P59_S2	Users can create advanced performance comparisons and in-depth analyses of an investment's underlying investment style, as well as custom-branded reports and presentations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P60_S0	In 2016, we continued developing Morningstar Direct Cloud (the next-generation version of Morningstar Direct).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P60_S1	These ongoing development efforts include rebuilding the platform to make it purely web-based and retooling existing capabilities to support users' daily workflow needs.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P61_S0	We also enhanced the data and research capabilities offered in Morningstar Direct during the year.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P61_S1	For example, we added the Morningstar Sustainability Rating for funds, which helps investors evaluate mutual funds and ETFs based on how well the companies held in their portfolios are managing their environmental, social, and governance (ESG) risks and opportunities.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P61_S2	We also introduced a new Global Risk Model, which helps investors understand and visualize the underlying factors that can drive the risk of a stock or portfolio.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P62_S0	Morningstar Direct's primary competitors are Bloomberg, eVestment Alliance, FactSet Research Systems, Thomson Reuters, and Zephyr Associates.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P63_S0	Morningstar Direct had approximately 12,500 licensed users worldwide as of December 31, 2016.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P64_S0	Pricing for Morningstar Direct is based on the number of licenses purchased.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P64_S1	For clients in the United States, we generally charge an annual fee of $17,500 for the first user, $11,000 for the second user, and $9,500 for each additional user.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P65_S0	Morningstar Direct is our second-largest product based on revenue and accounted for 13.8%, 12.9%, and 12.1% of our consolidated revenue in 2016, 2015, and 2014, respectively.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P66_S0	This product line includes several different offerings, including Morningstar Managed Portfolios, as well as services for institutional asset management, asset allocation, and manager selection.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P67_S0	Morningstar Managed Portfolios is a fee-based discretionary asset management service that includes a series of mutual fund, ETF, and stock portfolios tailored to meet specific investment time horizons and risk levels.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P67_S1	We offer this service through Morningstar Investment Services LLC, a registered investment advisor, registered broker-dealer, member of the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, Inc. (FINRA), and wholly owned subsidiary of Morningstar, Inc.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P67_S2	We offer Morningstar Managed Portfolios mainly to fee-based independent financial advisors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P67_S3	These advisors are often affiliated with the corporate registered investment arms of insurance companies and independent and registered broker-dealers.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P68_S0	We also provide other institutional asset management services for asset management firms, broker-dealers, and insurance providers, which we offer through a variety of registered entities in Australia, Dubai, France, Hong Kong, India, Japan, South Africa, South Korea, the United Kingdom, and the United States.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P68_S1	All of these entities are wholly owned or majority-owned subsidiaries of Morningstar, Inc., and are authorized to provide investment advisory services by the appropriate regulatory agency in their applicable jurisdictions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P69_S0	These services include institutional asset management, asset allocation, and manager selection services, which are investment recommendations delivered as select lists, based on a process that draws on our rated universe and manager selection methodology.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P70_S0	In 2016, we continued migrating functionality to the new Morningstar Managed Portfolios website from our legacy platform.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P70_S1	In response to growing client interest in low-cost portfolios accessible to smaller investors, we introduced the Morningstar Wealth Builder Asset Allocation Series.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P70_S2	We charge asset-based fees for Morningstar Managed Portfolios, which are typically based on a tiered schedule that depends on the client's average daily portfolio balance.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P70_S3	Fees for our mutual fund and ETF portfolios generally range from 30 to 40 basis points.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P70_S4	We charge 45 to 55 basis points for Select Stock Baskets, which are customizable stock portfolios based on Morningstar's proprietary equity research and indexes.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P70_S5	We use third-party custodians for Morningstar Managed Portfolios and do not hold the assets in custody.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P71_S0	We base pricing for our other investment management services on the scope of work, our degree of investment discretion, and the level of service required.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P71_S1	In the majority of our contracts, we receive asset-based fees, reflecting our work as a portfolio construction manager or subadvisor for multimanager portfolios.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P72_S0	For Morningstar Managed Portfolios, our primary competitors are AssetMark, Brinker Capital, Envestnet PMC, Loring Ward, and SEI Investments.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P72_S1	We also compete with in-house research teams at independent broker-dealers who build proprietary portfolios for use on brokerage firm platforms, as well other registered investment advisors that provide investment strategies or models on these platforms.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P73_S0	In our other investment management services, we compete with consulting firms such as Mercer, Callan, and Wilshire Associates, as well as various in-house providers of investment management services.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P74_S0	Morningstar Investment Management is our third-largest product based on revenue and made up 12.3% of revenue in 2016, compared with 12.5% in both 2015 and 2014.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P75_S0	Morningstar Advisor Workstation, a web-based investment planning system, provides financial advisors with a comprehensive set of tools for conducting their core business including investment research, planning, and presentations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P75_S1	It allows advisors to build and maintain a client portfolio database that can be fully integrated with the firm's back-office technology and resources.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P75_S2	Moreover, it helps advisors create customized reports for client portfolios that combine different types of investments.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P76_S0	Morningstar Advisor Workstation is available in two versions: Morningstar Office for independent financial advisors and an enterprise version for financial advisors affiliated with larger firms.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P76_S1	As of December 31, 2016, approximately 4,300 financial advisors in the United States were licensed to use Morningstar Office, and approximately 175 companies held licenses for the enterprise version of Morningstar Advisor Workstation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P77_S0	In 2016, we continued to enhance integrations with several leading third-party platforms to help advisors with all aspects of their daily workflows.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P77_S1	For example, we expanded our relationship with Redtail Technologies to fully integrate Redtail's customer relationship management (CRM) capabilities as part of Morningstar Office.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P78_S0	Pricing for Morningstar Advisor Workstation varies based on the number of users, as well as the number of databases licensed and level of functionality.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P78_S1	We typically charge annual fees of about $3,500 per licensed user for a base configuration of Morningstar Advisor Workstation, but pricing varies significantly based on the scope of the license.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P78_S2	We generally charge $6,000 per user for an annual license for Morningstar Office, as well as additional fees for portfolio accounting and record-keeping services.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P79_S0	Competitors for Morningstar Advisor Workstation and Morningstar Office include Black Diamond, Envestnet, Orion Advisor Services, S P Global, and Thomson Reuters.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P80_S0	Morningstar Advisor Workstation is our fourth-largest product based on revenue and made up 10.3% of revenue in both 2016 and 2015, compared with 10.5% in 2014.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P81_S0	This product line includes several different offerings, including retirement advice and managed accounts, plan sponsor advice, custom models, and financial wellness services.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P82_S0	Our advice and managed accounts program, Morningstar Retirement Manager, helps retirement plan participants with their retirement goals.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P82_S1	As part of this service, we deliver personalized recommendations for a target savings goal, a recommended contribution rate to help achieve that goal, a portfolio mix based on risk tolerance, and specific investment recommendations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P82_S2	Participants can build their own portfolios based on our recommendations or elect to have their accounts managed by us through our managed retirement account offering.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P82_S3	We do not hold assets in custody for the managed retirement accounts we provide.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P83_S0	In our plan sponsor advice business, we work with retirement plan sponsors to help them meet their fiduciary obligations by selecting and monitoring a broad range of diversified plan options.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P84_S0	We serve as a non-discretionary subadvisor and index provider for the Morningstar Lifetime Allocation Funds, a series of target-date collective investment trust funds (CITs) offered by UBS Asset Management to retirement plan sponsors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P85_S0	Retirement plan sponsors can select a conservative, moderate, or growth version of the funds based on the needs of participants in the plan.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P86_S0	With our custom models, we work with retirement plan providers to design customized models for their investment lineups, including target maturity models and risk-based models.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P87_S0	Through HelloWallet, we offer personalized financial guidance to individuals and their families through their employer benefit plans.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P87_S1	HelloWallet helps employees build a strong financial foundation by providing them with tools for emergency savings, debt management, and budgeting.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P88_S0	In 2016, we introduced Advisor Managed Accounts, a program that allows financial advisors to specify the portfolios that are used in an employer s managed account offering.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P88_S1	Within our financial wellness solution, we launched new guidance methodology that helps users understand the trade-offs between multiple goals such as paying down debt versus saving for retirement.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P89_S0	Pricing for Workplace Solutions depends on several different factors, including the level of services offered (including whether the services involve acting as a fiduciary under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act, or ERISA), the number of participants, the level of systems integration required, and the availability of competing products.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P89_S1	For HelloWallet, we charge employers for individual employee licenses at a rate of $50 to $100 per user per year.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P90_S0	Our main competitors for Workplace Solutions are Financial Engines, Guided Choice, Learnvest, and Personal Capital, as well as companies that provide automated investment advice, such as Betterment and Wealthfront.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P90_S1	For the Lifetime Allocation Funds, we compete with other providers of target-date funds, such as Vanguard, Fidelity, and T. Rowe Price.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P91_S0	Workplace Solutions is our fifth-largest product based on revenue and made up 8.9% of revenue in 2016, compared with 8.4% in 2015 and 7.5% in 2014.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P92_S0	Our largest website for individual investors is Morningstar.com.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P92_S1	Revenue for this product offering includes both Premium Memberships and Internet advertising sales, which each made up approximately half of Morningstar.com's total revenue in 2016.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P93_S0	In addition to our U.S.-based site, we offer more than 30 regional investing websites customized to the needs of investors worldwide.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P93_S1	Many of these sites feature coverage in local languages with tools and commentary tailored to specific markets.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P94_S0	We also offer paid Premium Membership, which includes access to written analyst reports on stocks, mutual funds, ETFs, and closed-end funds, as well as our Portfolio X-Ray, asset allocation and portfolio management tools, proprietary stock data, Stewardship Grades and Ratings, and premium stock and fund screeners.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P94_S1	We currently offer Premium Membership services in Australia, Canada, Italy, the United Kingdom, and the United States.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P95_S0	In 2016, we shifted a portion of the site's traffic to our newly redesigned beta site.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P95_S1	The site features a new user interface focused on helping individual investors select and monitor investments.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P95_S2	As part of this upgrade, we developed a new stock quote page that better surfaces Morningstar s proprietary research and ratings and a new picks center featuring curated lists of Morningstar's top-rated investments for specific needs, such as portfolio building, income, and retirement planning.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P95_S3	We plan to complete the rollout of the new site during 2017.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P96_S0	Finance, as well as other finance and brokerage sites.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P97_S0	As of December 31, 2016, the free membership services offered through Morningstar.com had 10.9 million registered users worldwide.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P97_S1	We also had approximately 118,000 paid Premium subscribers for Morningstar.com in the United States plus an additiona l 15,000 paid Premium subscribers in other global markets.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P97_S2	We currently charge $23.95 for a monthly subscription, $199 for an annual subscription, $339 for a two-year subscription, and $439 for a three-year subscription for Morningstar.com's Premium Membership service.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P98_S0	Morningstar Enterprise Components is a set of tools and capabilities that help institutional clients build customized websites or enhance their existing solutions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P98_S1	We offer a series of components, editorial content, and reports that investment firms can license to build or enhance their websites for financial advisors and individual investors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P98_S2	We also offer licenses for investment research, editorial content, and portfolio analysis and comparison tools that allow users to drill down into the underlying data when researching a potential investment.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P99_S0	In 2016, we introduced a beta version of the new Morningstar Developer platform, which provides clients with direct access to our tools, components, data, calculation engines, and APIs.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P99_S1	The site empowers clients by giving them the flexibility to develop their own solutions using Morningstar components.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P100_S0	For Enterprise Components, our primary competitors include Financial Express, Interactive Data Corporation, Markit on Demand, and Thomson Reuters.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P101_S0	Pricing for Enterprise Components consists of both ongoing license fees and one-time development fees and depends on the solution being offered, the number of users and level of distribution, and the amount of client integration involved.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P102_S0	We offer Morningstar Research, including Equity Research and Manager Research, through Morningstar Research Services LLC and a variety of other subsidiaries outside the United States.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P102_S1	We offer Equity Research to institutional investors who use it to supplement their own research, as well as to broker-dealers who provide our research to their affiliated financial advisors or individual investor clients.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P102_S2	Our Manager Research services help institutional investors and manager research due diligence teams evaluate funds, investment strategies, and asset management firms.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P103_S0	During 2016, we expanded our analyst equity analyst coverage in the Asia/Pacific region in response to client demand, adding additional equity analysts in Singapore and Tokyo.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P103_S1	We now have approximately 20 analysts in Asia (excluding Australia/New Zealand).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P104_S0	In manager research, we expanded our market efforts with wealth management firms to highlight how we can help meet the workflow needs of their due diligence groups.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P104_S1	Our due diligence offering combines our analyst research content, analyst access, and qualitative ratings with screening, alerting, and scorecard capabilities in Morningstar Direct.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P104_S2	Wealth management firms are increasingly facing regulatory pressures to document the research process behind their investment recommendations, and our manager research capabilities help these firms do this.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P105_S0	Our Equity Research services compete with CFRA Research (formerly S P Capital IQ Equity Research) and Zack's Investment Research, as well as sell-side firms, internal providers, and smaller boutique firms.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P105_S1	Our Manager Research services mainly compete with Mercer, Willis Towers Watson, and Wilshire Associates.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P106_S0	Pricing for Morningstar Research varies based on the level of distribution, the type of investors who are using our research, the number of securities or investment strategies covered, the amount of custom coverage and client support required, and the length of the contract term.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P107_S0	PitchBook Data, Inc., which Morningstar acquired in December 2016, provides data, research, and technology covering the private capital markets, including venture capital, private equity, and mergers and acquisitions (M A).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P108_S0	PitchBook's main product is the PitchBook Platform, an all-in-one research and analysis workstation for sophisticated investment and research professionals.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P108_S1	More than 8,000 professionals use this software to source deals, raise funds, build buyer lists, create benchmarks, network, and more.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P108_S2	To accommodate their diverse needs, the Platform offers advanced search functionality, a fully customizable dashboard and email alerts that help users discover and monitor relevant information.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P109_S0	PitchBook also offers a mobile application, Excel plug-in, data feeds, and flexible, a la carte data solutions that allow clients to access a variety of data points on demand.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P110_S0	PitchBook's main competitors are CB Insights, Dow Jones VentureSource, Prequin, S P Capital IQ, and Thomson Reuters.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P111_S0	Pricing for the PitchBook Platform is based on the number of seats, with the standard base license generally priced at $27,500 for the first five seats, and pricing for additional seats generally priced at $5,500 per user, with customized prices for large enterprises, boutiques, and startup firms.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P112_S0	Morningstar Credit Ratings, LLC is an NRSRO that provides timely new issue and surveillance ratings and analysis for structured credits, as well as operational risk assessment services.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P112_S1	We provide ratings on a broad range of structured finance securities, including commercial mortgage-backed securities, residential mortgage-backed securities, single-family rental securities, and asset-backed securities.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P113_S0	In 2016, Morningstar Credit Ratings received approval from the SEC to expand its NRSRO designation to include corporate credit issuers and financial institutions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P113_S1	We also expanded our research and ratings on a variety of additional asset-backed securities and collateralized loan obligations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P114_S0	This business competes with several other firms, including DBRS, Fitch, Kroll Bond Ratings, Moody s, and S P Global Ratings.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P115_S0	We charge annual fees for our subscription-based CMBS surveillance software and data services, which are paid for by the user.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P115_S1	Pricing for these services varies depending on the solution and the level of access within a client organization.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P115_S2	For new-issue ratings, we charge one-time fees to the issuer based on the type of security, the size of the transaction, and the complexity of the issue.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P115_S3	In addition to the initial rating fee, clients pay annual surveillance fees that continue until the securities mature.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P116_S0	We offer an extensive set of investment indexes that can be used to benchmark the market and create investment products, including indexes that track the U.S. market by capitalization, sector, and investment style; dividend indexes; active equity indexes based on Morningstar s equity research; bond indexes; commodity indexes; hedge fund indexes; and asset allocation indexes.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P117_S0	In 2016, we launched a family of Global Sustainability Indexes that incorporate ESG factors into the investment process.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P117_S1	The indexes serve as benchmarks for active managers and as portfolio building blocks for creating passively managed investment products.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P118_S0	We also introduced the Morningstar Open Indexes Project, offering asset managers and other firms the ability to benchmark their investments against more than 100 Morningstar global equity indexes for free.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P118_S1	The goal of the project is to lower costs for the industry and improve outcomes for investors in response to the escalating cost of market-cap-weighted equity indexes.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P118_S2	The indexes include equity benchmarks across sectors, styles, and regions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P118_S3	Participants will receive price return, total return, net return, and month-end constituent data for indexes included in the project.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P119_S0	We currently license Morningstar Indexes to numerous institutions that offer ETFs and exchange-traded notes based on the indexes.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P119_S1	Firms can license Morningstar Indexes for both product creation (where we typically receive the greater of a minimum fee or basis points tied to assets under management) and data licensing (where we typically receive annual licensing fees).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P119_S2	In both cases, our pricing varies based on the level of distribution, the type of user, and the specific indexes licensed.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P120_S0	Major competitors for Morningstar Indexes include FTSE Russell, MSCI, S P Dow Jones Indices (offered through S P Global), and Research Affiliates.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P121_S0	We offer a variety of other products and services, including:
1289419_17_ITEM1_P122_S0	Other investment software for financial advisors and institutions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P123_S0	We conduct our business operations outside of the United States through wholly owned or majority-owned operating subsidiaries based in each of the following 26 countries: Australia, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Denmark, France, Germany, India, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, Mexico, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, People's Republic of China (both Hong Kong and the mainland), Singapore, South Africa, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, United Arab Emirates, and the United Kingdom.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P123_S1	See Note 5 of the Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information concerning revenue from customers and long-lived assets from our business operations outside the United States.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P124_S0	We treat our brand, product names and logos, software, technology, databases, and other products as proprietary.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P124_S1	We seek to protect this intellectual property by using trademark, copyright, patent and trade secrets laws; licensing and nondisclosure arrangements; and other security measures.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P124_S2	For example, we generally provide our intellectual property to third parties through standard licensing agreements, which define the extent and duration of any third-party usage rights and provide for our continued ownership in any intellectual property furnished.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P125_S0	Because of the value of our brand name and logo, we generally seek to register one or both of them in all of the relevant international classes under the trademark laws that apply to jurisdictions where we operate.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P125_S1	We have registered the Morningstar name and/or logo in numerous countries and the European Union and have applied for registrations in various other countries.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P125_S2	In some jurisdictions, we also register certain product names.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P126_S0	Morningstar and the Morningstar logo are registered marks of Morningstar in the United States and in certain other jurisdictions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P127_S0	In addition to trademarks, we currently hold several patents in the United States, including patents held by Morningstar Investment Management LLC for lifetime asset allocation and asset allocation with annuities.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P128_S0	We license our products and/or other intellectual property to our customers, generally for a fee.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P128_S1	As a rule, we use our standard agreements, whether in paper or electronic form, and we do not provide our products and services to customers or other users without having an agreement in place.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P129_S0	We maintain licensing agreements with most of our larger operating companies.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P129_S1	We put these agreements in place so these companies can use our intellectual property, such as our products and trademarks, to market our products and develop and sell country-specific variants of products under the Morningstar name in their operating territories.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P130_S0	In the ordinary course of our business, we obtain and use intellectual property from a wide variety of sources, including licensing it from third-party sources, developing it internally, and recording it based on information found in public filings.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P131_S0	We believe our business has a minimal amount of seasonality.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P131_S1	Some of our smaller products, such as our annual investment conference in Chicago, generate the majority of their revenue in the first or second quarter of the year.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P131_S2	We sell most of our products with subscription or license terms of at least one year, though, and we recognize revenue ratably over the term of each subscription or license agreement.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P131_S3	This tends to offset most of the seasonality in our business.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P132_S0	We believe market movements generally have more influence on our performance than seasonality.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P132_S1	The revenue we earn from asset-based fees depends on the value of assets on which we provide advisory services, and the size of our asset base can increase or decrease along with trends in market performance.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P133_S0	In 2016, our largest customer accounted for less than 2% of our consolidated revenue.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P134_S0	The economic and financial information industry includes a few large firms as well as numerous smaller companies, including startup firms.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P134_S1	Some of our main competitors include Bloomberg, S P Global, and Thomson Reuters.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P134_S2	These companies have financial resources that are significantly greater than ours.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P134_S3	We also compete with a variety of other companies in specific areas of our business.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P134_S4	We discuss some of the key competitors in each area in the Major Products and Services section of this report.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P135_S0	We believe the most important competitive factors in our industry are brand and reputation, data accuracy and quality, technology, breadth of data coverage, quality of investment research and analytics, design, product reliability, and value of the products and services provided.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P136_S0	A key aspect of our growth strategy is to expand our investment research capabilities and enhance our existing products and services.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P136_S1	We strive to adopt new technology that can improve our products and services.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P136_S2	As a general practice, we manage our own websites and build our own software rather than relying on outside vendors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P136_S3	This allows us to control our technology development and better manage costs, enabling us to respond quickly to market changes and to meet customer needs efficiently.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P137_S0	As of December 31, 2016, our technology team consisted of approximately 1,280 programmers and technology and infrastructure professionals.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P138_S0	Investment advisory and broker-dealer businesses are subject to extensive regulation in the United States at both the federal and state level, as well as by self-regulatory organizations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P138_S1	Financial services companies are among the nation's most extensively regulated.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P138_S2	The SEC is responsible for enforcing the federal securities laws and oversees federally registered investment advisors and broker-dealers.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P139_S0	Three of our subsidiaries, Morningstar Investment Management LLC, Morningstar Investment Services LLC, and Morningstar Research Services LLC, are registered as investment advisors with the SEC under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 (Advisers Act).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P139_S1	As registered investment advisors, these companies are subject to the requirements and regulations of the Advisers Act.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P139_S2	These requirements relate to, among other things, record-keeping, reporting, and standards of care, as well as general anti-fraud prohibitions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P140_S0	As registered investment advisors, these subsidiaries are subject to on-site examination by the SEC.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P141_S0	In addition, in cases where these subsidiaries provide investment advisory services to retirement plans and their participants, they may be acting as fiduciaries under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P141_S1	As fiduciaries under ERISA, they have duties of loyalty and prudence, as well as duties to diversify investments and to follow plan documents to comply with the applicable portions of ERISA.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P142_S0	Morningstar Investment Services is a broker-dealer registered under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (Exchange Act) and a member of FINRA.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P142_S1	The regulation of broker-dealers has, to a large extent, been delegated by the federal securities laws to self-regulatory organizations, including FINRA.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P142_S2	Subject to approval by the SEC, FINRA adopts rules that govern its members.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P143_S0	FINRA and the SEC conduct periodic examinations of the brokerage operations of Morningstar Investment Services.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P144_S0	Broker-dealers are subject to regulations that cover all aspects of the securities business, including sales, capital structure, record-keeping, and the conduct of directors, officers, and employees.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P144_S1	Violation of applicable regulations can result in the revocation of a broker-dealer license, the imposition of censures or fines, and the suspension or expulsion of a firm or its officers or employees.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P145_S0	As a registered broker-dealer, Morningstar Investment Services is subject to certain net capital requirements under the Exchange Act.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P145_S1	These requirements are designed to regulate the financial soundness and liquidity of broker-dealers.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P146_S0	Morningstar Credit Ratings, LLC is registered with the SEC as a Nationally Recognized Statistical Rating Organization (NRSRO) specializing in rating structured finance investments, corporate credit issuers, and financial institutions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P146_S1	As an NRSRO, Morningstar Credit Ratings is subject to certain requirements and regulations under the Exchange Act.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P146_S2	These requirements relate to, among other things, record-keeping, reporting, governance, and conflicts of interest.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P147_S0	As part of its NRSRO registration, Morningstar Credit Ratings is subject to annual examination by the SEC.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P148_S0	Our subsidiaries that provide financial information services and advice in Australia, Morningstar Australasia Pty Limited and Morningstar Investment Management Australia Ltd., are registered under an Australian Financial Services license and are subject to oversight by the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC).
1289419_17_ITEM1_P148_S1	This license requires them to, among other things, maintain positive net asset levels and sufficient cash resources to cover three months of expenses and to comply with the audit requirements of the ASIC.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P149_S0	Morningstar Investment Management Europe Limited is authorized and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) to provide advisory services in the United Kingdom.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P149_S1	As an authorized firm, Morningstar Investment Management Europe Limited is subject to the requirements and regulations of the FCA.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P149_S2	Such requirements relate to, among other things, financial reporting and other reporting obligations, record-keeping, and cross-border requirements.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P150_S0	We have a variety of other entities (including in Canada, France, Hong Kong, India, Japan, Korea, South Africa, and Thailand) that are registered with their respective regulatory bodies; however, the amount of business conducted by these entities related to the registration is relatively small.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P151_S0	Additional legislation and regulations, including those relating to the activities of investment advisors and broker-dealers, changes in rules imposed by the SEC or other U.S. or non-U.S. regulatory authorities and self-regulatory organizations, or changes in the interpretation or enforcement of existing laws and rules may adversely affect our business and profitability.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P152_S0	We had 4,595 employees globally as of December 31, 2016, including approximately 800 data analysts, 90 designers, 500 investment analysts (including consulting and quantitative research analysts), 1,280 programmers and technology staff, and 750 sales and marketing professionals.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P152_S1	Our U.S.-based employees are not represented by any unions, and we have never experienced a walkout or strike.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P153_S0	As of February 28, 2017 , we had nine executive officers.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P153_S1	The table below summarizes information about each of these officers.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P154_S0	* On February 21, 2017, St phane notified us that he is resigning from his position effective March 10, 2017.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P154_S1	Kunal Kapoor will serve as interim chief financial officer until we name a replacement.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P155_S0	Joe Mansueto founded Morningstar in 1984 and became executive chairman in 2017.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P155_S1	He has served as chairman of the board since the company's inception.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P155_S2	He served as our chief executive officer from 1984 to 1996 and again from 2000 to 2016.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P156_S0	Under Joe s leadership, Morningstar has been named twice to Fortune magazine s 100 Best Companies to Work For list, in 2011 and 2012.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P156_S1	The Chicago Tribune recognized Morningstar as one of the top 100 workplaces in the Chicago area in 2010, 2011, and 2012, and Crain s Chicago Business listed Morningstar in its Fast Fifty feature in 2007, 2008, 2009, and 2011.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P156_S2	Morningstar won the 2010 AIGA Chicago Chapter Corporate Design Leadership Award, which recognizes forward-thinking organizations that have advanced design by promoting it as a meaningful business policy.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P157_S0	In December 2016, InvestmentNews named Joe to its list of 20 Icons Innovators.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P157_S1	MutualFundWire.com recognized Joe as one of the 10 most influential individuals in the mutual fund industry in 2015, and he was the recipient of PLANSPONSOR s Lifetime Achievement Award in 2013.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P157_S2	In 2010, Joe received the Tiburon CEO Summit award, MutualFundWire.com named him ninth on its list of the 100 Most Influential People of the year, and Chicago magazine listed Joe among its top 40 Chicago pioneers over the past four decades.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P157_S3	In 2007, SmartMoney magazine recognized him in the SmartMoney Power 30, its annual list of the 30 most powerful forces in business and finance.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P157_S4	He received the Distinguished Entrepreneurial Alumnus Award from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business in 2000.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P158_S0	Joe holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from The University of Chicago and a master's degree in business administration from The University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P159_S0	Kunal Kapoor is chief executive officer of Morningstar and a member of our board of directors.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P159_S1	Before assuming his current role in 2017, he served as president, responsible for product development and innovation, sales and marketing, and driving strategic prioritization across the firm.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P160_S0	Before becoming president in 2015, Kunal was head of global products and client solutions.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P161_S0	Kunal became head of our global client solutions group in 2013 and took on additional responsibility for the products group in February 2014.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P161_S1	For part of 2013, he was president of our Data Division, and from 2010 until 2012, he was president of Equity and Market Data/Software.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P161_S2	In 2009 and 2010, he was president of Individual Software.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P162_S0	He holds a bachelor's degree in economics and environmental policy from Monmouth College and a master's degree in business administration from The University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P162_S1	He also holds the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P163_S0	As chief financial officer, St phane Biehler is responsible for corporate finance, accounting, tax, and investor relations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P163_S1	He joined us in 2013 and previously served as executive vice president, chief accounting officer, and corporate controller for NYSE Euronext, a global operator of financial markets, since 2007.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P163_S2	Before the 2007 merger of NYSE Group with Euronext to form NYSE Euronext and the 2006 merger of Archipelago Holdings with the New York Stock Exchange to form NYSE Group, he was managing director and corporate controller for Archipelago Holdings, which he joined in 2004.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P164_S0	On February 21, 2017, St phane notified us that he is resigning from his position effective March 10, 2017.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P164_S1	Kunal Kapoor will serve as interim chief financial officer until we name a replacement.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P165_S0	St phane holds a master s degree in international business from the University of Haute-Alsace in France.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P166_S0	Bevin Desmond is head of global markets and human resources, a role she has held since 2010.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P166_S1	She is responsible for identifying, developing, managing and directing international operations, and overseeing human resources functions for all of Morningstar s global operations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P166_S2	Previously, she was head of international operations from 2001 until 2010.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P167_S0	Bevin holds a bachelor's degree in psychology from St. Mary's College.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P168_S0	Danny Dunn is chief revenue officer for Morningstar.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P168_S1	He is responsible for sales philosophy, strategy, and execution in order to drive revenue growth.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P169_S0	Before joining Morningstar in 2016, Danny was vice president of the Midwest enterprise unit for IBM, a global information technology firm.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P169_S1	He was responsible for marketing, strategy, sales, channels, and customer service for the complete IBM portfolio, including Cloud, Software, Services, Systems, and IBM Credit, LLC in the region.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P169_S2	Prior to that, he was regional director for IBM's Chicago enterprise unit in 2013 and 2014, territory director for IBM's Wisconsin business unit from 2011 until June 2013, and territory sales leader for IBM Global Services from 2009 until July 2011.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P169_S3	Before joining IBM in 2007, he led sales, account management, and client service at Neology, a software and technology consulting division of SmithBucklin Corporation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P170_S0	Danny holds a bachelor s degree from the University of Vermont and a master s degree in business administration, with concentrations in marketing, strategy, and managerial economics, from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P171_S0	Haywood Kelly Haywood Kelly is head of global research for Morningstar and oversees our global fund, equity, and credit research and data operations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P171_S1	Before taking on his current role in January 2014, he was head of equity and credit research since 2009 and took on additional responsibility for equity data in 2013.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P171_S2	He holds a bachelor s degree in economics from The University of Chicago, where he graduated as a member of Phi Beta Kappa.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P171_S3	He also holds the CFA designation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P172_S0	Patrick Maloney is general counsel for Morningstar.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P172_S1	He is responsible for directing Morningstar s legal department and managing its relationships with outside counsel.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P172_S2	He also oversees Morningstar s compliance department.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P173_S0	Before joining Morningstar in June 2016, Patrick was a partner at Sheppard Mullin Richter Hampton LLP from July 2012 through April 2016 in the firm s corporate and securities practice.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P173_S1	Previously, he was a partner at K L Gates LLP and its legacy predecessor firm, Bell, Boyd Lloyd LLP.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P173_S2	Early in his career, he was an associate with the New York law firm of Dewey Ballantine and an Assistant General Counsel with the Prudential Insurance Company of America.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P173_S3	Patrick holds a bachelor s degree with honors from the University of Chicago and a juris doctor degree with honors from the University of Chicago Law School.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P173_S4	He is admitted to practice law in Illinois and New York.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P174_S0	Daniel Needham Daniel Needham is president and chief investment officer (CIO) of Morningstar Investment Management and is responsible for building world-class investment management solutions based on our proprietary research.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P174_S1	Before taking on his current role in February 2015, he served as CIO for Morningstar Investment Management, and was previously managing director and CIO for Morningstar Investment Management s Asia-Pacific Operations.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P175_S0	He joined our company when Morningstar acquired Intech Pty Ltd (now Ibbotson Associates Australia) in 2009, where he served as chief investment officer.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P175_S1	Before joining Intech in 2002, Daniel worked for Zurich Financial Services in Sydney.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P176_S0	He holds a bachelor's degree in commerce with a major in finance and economics from the University of Sydney.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P176_S1	He also holds the CFA designation.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P177_S0	Tricia Rothschild is chief product officer for Morningstar.
1289419_17_ITEM1_P177_S1	She is responsible for product strategy, innovation, development, and execution for the solutions delivered to clients.
